name: Stephanie Ulrich
text:
Denise is top notch! I had a 2:00 meeting scheduled with her yesterday.  She was on time, professional and at the end of listening me with my thought process on my plants and design, we both agreed, I didn't need her services.

I have extensive knowledge of my plants and just needed some guidance on what other plant options would work best for this area.  She could have left at that moment but instead she took the time to write down plants that she recommends and where to place them.

Who does that in 2020?  For free?  I would highly  recommend Denise for any of your plant/design needs.  I will definitely tell all my friends about her services.

resp.text: Thank you for the positive and kind feedback! I'm glad I could help. Good luck with you landscape project!

name: Troy Schoenfelder
text:
Denise and Beth were great to work with. I know my wife and I saved money in the long run by having a landscape designer walk us through our entire project.

Thanks again Denise and Beth!

resp.text: Thank you Troy.  We are glad we could help!

name: Brooke Wachs
text: Denise provided a wonderful, family-friendly design for our backyard. She worked with us on all the details--patio design, garden bed and herb garden design, seating areas and pathways, even the location of our swingset. And of course all of the plants! We wanted to do mostly native plants and a cottage-style garden throughout the yard and the design she provided was even better than what we'd imagined. She listened to our input on specific plants that we wanted and worked all of those in, plus had many ideas we hadn't thought of. She patiently worked with us through several iterations of the design and helped with material selections for the hardscaping. Highly recommend and we plan on working with her again when we do the front yard!

resp.text: Thank you! I look forward to working with you on your front yard project!

name: Suzanna Vellacott-Ford
text:
Denise provided the design for our backyard and we are very happy with her work.

We told her we wanted low-maintenance landscaping that would be colorful all year and attract bees and butterflies.

Her design has a beautiful, unique layout. She also gave us a binder with detailed information about every plant in the design, including maintenance instructions and general tips for pruning, etc.

Denise recommends and works closely with HIS Landscapes to implement her designs. I would not recommend HIS Landscapes (you can see my review on their page).

name: Jennifer Burger
text: We had an appointment for a design quote on all new landscaping out front and on the side of our home. No call no show. Back to square one finding a company to do our home.

name: Dan Harn
text: Denise is awesome. We hired her for consultation only in our backyard because we felt comfortable doing a lot of it ourselves. But we needed the help with the design. She was spot on. Plus, she took the time to help us plants in the front yard. I would highly recommend Denise for your landscape designs or even if you just need that tweak to make the yard look better.

resp.text: Thank you!  Good luck with your backyard project!

name: Deb Robinson
text:
Denise is awesome!  She listened to everything I said and included all of my wish-list into the design.  Pricing was easily in line with the effort she took to develop the plan and the deliverables once it was finished.

I cannot WAIT to see the design executed once the installers come in and bring our vision to life!

name: Tami Owen
text: If you are looking for someone that will take you landscape to a new level, Green Thumb is just who you are looking for.  Denise is such a talented designer who really listens to the customer and brings your ideas to life. Her designs are beautiful, functional, and affordable. I would highly recommend Green Thumb for all of your labdscape projects.

name: Sullivan Edwards (Sully)
text:
Abraham and his crew were professional, courteous, and performed everything that I expected, while keeping me informed if anything unexpected came up.

They fixed some major drainage and erosion issues in the back yard (see before and after photos) by burying downspouts, building a French drain that went out to the road, and tying the downspouts into the drain. It is super satisfying to watch tons of water just pouring out of the drain into the street after a heavy rain.

They also graded and re-sodded the yard with Zoysia for less than it would have cost me to personally buy the Zoysia and lay the sod myself. I highly recommend Legacy for your personal landscaping project.

resp.text: Mr. Edwards,  We would like to take the opportunity to thank you so very much for the positive review.  Abraham enjoyed working on your drainage project and we are truly blessed to have such great people working with us to help solve issues that our customers may be having.  Have a great summer!

name: Rene' Holt
text: I never like to leave bad reviews and always try to keep them positive, but I contacted this company to help with some backyard design and remodel. I had a meeting scheduled with Jacob this past Wednesday and when he was 30 minutes late, I called the office to make sure nothing was wrong. Jacob called back and offered no apology for being a no-show but we rescheduled for today. It's a hour last our appointment time and he didn't show up again with no call and didn't answer his phone. If you can't be professional enough to keep scheduled appointments, twice, you're not a company I want to work with.

resp.text: Rene', thank you so very much for letting us know about the appointment issues.  This rarely happens, let alone 2 times.  Jacob inadvertently kept the same time from last week's appointment on his calendar and received a notice this morning that you cancelled the appointment, assuming it was this afternoon.  We regret that we were not able to be of assistance with your backyard project and appreciate again the review so that we can strive to do better, even in such a crazy year!    Tami

name: Neva Turner
text:
Our experience with Legacy truly deserves 10 stars. From first contact they have been the best company we have ever worked with. Everything was done timely and professionally. Quality is top notch. They have shown quality of work ethic beyond measure. We highly recommend this company. During this difficult time with Covid 19, working with everyone at Legacy has been inspiring and uplifting.
Great company !!

resp.text: Neva, getting to know you and your husband has been one of the highlights of our year.  You are such a pleasure to work for and your appreciation and kindness have not gone unnoticed.  The crew always enjoys working with you on your projects and we look forward to seeing what else you may have in store for your beautiful home!

name: Heather Meacham
text: Paul and Tami are so great to work with.  They pay attention to every detail and our patio is just perfect.  Very professional!!!

resp.text: Heather, it was such a pleasure to work with you on your patio project.  I absolutely love the color of the concrete,  it was an excellent choice.  Thank you again and enjoy your new patio!

name: Jason Comfort
text:
First let me say that my wife and I are extremely pleased with the work.  More importantly, Abraham and his crew were phenomenal.  They were cognizant of the fact that my neighbors and I are all working from home and kept the noise at a minimum.  They went out of their way not to leave a mess after the first day after asking what our HOA restrictions were.  When they were finished, they had filled in the large hole my dogs had dug and placed down a few pieces of sod to cover some bare spots.  Truly outstanding service.

Lastly, when they were finished, and before they left, your team saw one of my neighbors struggling to unload a trailer.  They offered to help unload the heavy item for him.  They were truly great ambassadors for the company.

We have some pretty grand plans for our back yard that will stretch over the next couple of years.  After this experience, I guarantee that we will be reaching back out to Legacy Outdoor Services.

resp.text: Jason, Thank you ever so much for the review!  Your patience as we worked on your project was very much appreciated as the wet weather  makes drainage work even more challenging.  We are very blessed to have great teams working with us and we can't wait to see what else you have in store for your home.  Have a great summer@

name: debi frankowski
text:
We are so pleased with the work that Legacy Outdoor Services just completed at our house.  They installed and sculpted the most beautiful waterfall feature in our mountainside back yard, along with up-lighting that really looks awesome in the evening.  Additionally, they put in a flagstone patio with a gas fire pit, with beautiful natural landscape features and mulch beds all around.  We have had many compliments on it, and it is surprisingly low maintenance too!  We just love it!
We had several unforeseen complications which were out of Legacy's control, related to our gas line installation and inspection,  that Legacy patiently and proactively worked through.  We appreciated their high level of customer service and commitment, and will certainly use them again in the future!

resp.text: Debi, We absolutely loved working with you both!  You have such a nice home and we were so happy to be able to help you design an outdoor living area that accented your already existing hillside.  You have been so very patient as we worked towards getting your gas issue resolved.  Now you can sit back and enjoy all the elements together that make for a very relaxing getaway!

name: Jacquelyn Pletcher
text:
Make sure your quote is EXTREMELY detailed, and that you’re home and watching every step they take for quotes involving construction. Otherwise you’ll end up with new concrete that is uneven (that will forever pool water TOWARDS your home), concrete paint that is already permanently stained with mud BEFORE they leave/finish, deep tracks in your sod because they will drive a concrete truck in your backyard, ground/grass that isn’t graded back the way it was before construction and therefore leaving extremely uneven muddy hills all over your yard, nails and cigarettes in your yard WEEKS after they leave, and a final structure that is uneven, sealed poorly, with paint drips that have dried.

Would not refer.

resp.text: Jacquelyn,  We just wanted to thank you for taking time out of your busy schedule to leave us a review.  It is always important for a business to strive to grow in their professionalism and communication skills.  That growth is hindered if someone does not express their concerns that arise during and after a project.  Thank you again!

name: Aurora Marmolejo
text: I had some pavers placed around my back screen porch and a flower bedding put in front of my home. They did awesome work always done within two days and they cleaned the area really good. I highly recommend Legacy outdoor services.

resp.text:
Aurora, Thank you so much for taking the time to leave us a review!  The crews commented on how very kind you were to them while they were working and that means a lot.  We are excited for you to be able to use your new space and look forward to helping you in the future!
Tami

name: Susan Tuck
text: We hired Legacy Outdoor Services for a drainage issue.  We quoted several other companies as well.  Not only did Legacy provide a detailed quote with the scope of work to be performed it was very priced very competitively.  The entire staff is to be commended.  I was kept informed as to when the job would be started without having to follow up.  When the crew arrived they were well prepared and ready to work.  This is by far the best crew I have seen.  They worked extremely well as a team.  This was a messy job to say the least.  The clean up was amazing.  When they left you couldn’t even tell they had been there!  I would highly recommend Legacy for your outdoor needs.

resp.text: Susan, thank you ever so much for the positive feedback.  We appreciate greatly the opportunity to help you with your drainage issues and we are glad that we were able to meet your expectations!

name: Madeline Ortiz
text: Great experience, really pleased with the result Good communication and work complete on time. Definitely will do business again. Highly recommend this business

resp.text: Madeline,  thank you so very much for the positive review.  It was such a pleasure to meet with you and to design a landscape you can enjoy for many years to come!

name: Diane Cooper
text: Legacy Outdoor helped me get a couple of trees planted in my bare back yard.  They look nice and the hummingbirds are already checking the Japanese Maple out.  Tammy and I worked together to find the perfect trees, exactly what I wanted.

resp.text: Diane, you have been so great to work with over the past several years.  We appreciate the opportunity to help you with new projects and look forward to many more in the future.  Thanks again!

name: J M
text: My yard is really uneven in places after having new sod laid and the length of time for them to get my project done is what gives them three stars. Otherwise, they did a good job.

resp.text: Your feedback is greatly appreciated!  This year has been rather frustrating as covid, weather, and supply issues have caused delays that we have not had to deal with in the past.  Nonetheless, we are grateful for your patience and we wish you a safe and healthy rest of the year.

name: JB Robins
text: Legacy Outdoor Services did a most beautiful job landscaping my front yard.  They installed a stone border around my flower beds and perfectly matched the stone with the stone on my house.  They added so much color to my yard with yellow, red and green shrubs and added even more color with flowers.  It is outstanding and I am extremely pleased.  The landscape workers are very professional and polite.  They were always on time and did what they promised each day.  The owner, Tami, came by most days to ensure that I was happy with the way the job was going.  They are very flexible and allowed me to do add-ons as we progressed.  I plan to re-landscape the back yard next and I will be using Legacy.  Their work is excellent!!!!

resp.text: Ms. Jan, thank you so very much for the great review!  We very much enjoyed helping you with your landscape project and we can't wait to see what new ideas you will have for us in the future!

name: Patrick Miller
text: We are very happy with the work that was done. Owners and workers were extremely professional and courteous. Work was done on time and within budget. We can highly recommend this company.

resp.text: Patrick,  it was such a wonderful experience to work with you and your wife on this project.  To be able to add more outdoor area for you to enjoy while adding a functional walkway was our goal.  It was rather hot and your attention to our crew was appreciated.  Again, thank you for your review.

name: Joy Fitzpatrick
text: Loved working with Legacy on my landscaping and hardscaping.  They have a lot of creative ideas and deliver as promised. Their employees were respectful and pleasant to work with. I'll be contacting them again when I install a pergola and some additional projects.

resp.text: Joy,  Thank you so much for the encouraging review!  You had such great ideas that were not like most cookie cutter landscapes you might see.  It was so much fun finding unique plants and I have to admit there are more "tropical" options for this area than I thought.  You are great to work with and I hope that we have the opportunity to help you again in the future.

name: Carol Johnson
text:
We chose Legacy Outdoor Services to implement the first phase of a multi-year landscape plan for our new house. It was an excellent experience all around and we are very, very pleased with the results. Everyone there is a pleasure to work with. Paul walked through the project with us when he did our estimate, and proposed several changes to our designer’s plan that were improved solutions to fix our yard’s drainage challenges. Jessica, the office manager, was always responsive to questions, and Tami did a great job hunting down the plants we selected — which wasn’t that easy in September. When they couldn’t find the specific plants on our plan, she collaborated with us to select acceptable substitutes.
Austin, our project manager, and his crew were wonderful. They are great guys, hard workers, and do an amazing job. Even the installation was a collaborative experience. Austin suggested an additional dry creek bed on the side of the yard to deal with the excess water that funnels into our yard from the neighbor’s driveway. We are looking forward to working with Legacy again next year when we install the next phase of our landscape plan!

resp.text:
Carol, you were such a pleasure to work with and everyone agreed that your design was just beautiful!
We can't wait to see what the next phase has in store.  Thank you again.

name: Dana Williams
text: I had drainage work done and these guys did great. Paul and his crew got on the work quickly and worked hard to complete the job through some very difficult conditions. Austin ran the crew and he was an expert at his work and went well beyond to finish a french drain, grading and downspout pipes to the street. Austin is a fine person to work with as well as his second in charge Abraham.

resp.text: Dana, thank you so very much for the encouraging words!  You are right, sometimes the wet weather makes drainage work rather challenging.  You were both so very patient and helpful during the whole process and we are so very thankful for the opportunity to help you with your drainage issues.

name: Joey Borders
text: If you need landscaping done give Legacy a call. They do all kinds of work, but we personally had hardscaping done. They came out, viewed our patio, designed a new layout, tweaked it a few times to get it within our budget, and completed the work. I even reached out to several other companies in the beginning stages. Legacy gave us the best design with the best cost. We worked with David the majority of the time. He and the company are professional. Extremely courteous and will answer any questions/concerns. Two thumbs up.

resp.text: Joey,  We absolutely loved your design, it was unique and functional for your family.  You were such a pleasure to work with and we appreciate the opportunity to help you with your hardscape project.  Have a great spring!

name: Diane Moore
text: Legacy Outdoor Services has a great team of people and are so easy to work with.  We hired them to do some ground prep work before we installed our above ground pool.  The workers were very courteous, polite, and always showed up on time.  We couldn’t have asked for a better job and highly recommend them!

resp.text: Diane, thank you ever so much for letting us know about your experience!  As always, it was a pleasure working with you and we look forward to more projects in the future!

name: Lisa
text: Legacy Outdoor Services is the only service of this type that I will use.  They have done multiple projects for me over the course of the last few years.  Their workers are always respectful and courteous. As a woman with workers on my property, that is very important to me.  They truly go the extra mile in making sure that I am completely satisfied with their work.  Whenever the opportunity arises, I am happy to recommend Legacy to anyone who needs work done, and I do so with the utmost confidence in the caliber of work that they will provide.

resp.text:
Ms. Lisa,
It has been the utmost pleasure to work with you on all of your projects.  Your ideas are unique and beautiful and it has been a wonderful experience bringing those ideas to life.  Customer relations is very important and we are so grateful for the opportunity to be involved in meeting your expectations.

name: Tami McGhee
text: I chose Legacy Outdoor Services for a flower bed landscaping project last year and recently for a drainage project.  The owner, office staff and workers were all very knowledgeable, professional and a pleasure to work with.  I was very pleased with the work as well as the follow-up to ensure my satisfaction with the projects.

resp.text: Tami,  It was such a pleasure helping you with your project!  Drainage issues can be overwhelming and costly if not taken care of, we are so very pleased that we were able to help you with your issues and look forward to any future projects you may have.

name: Ch Carter
text: Called and tried to get an estimate to install landscaping in the rear of our newly purchased home and we're told we're outside " Legacy's service area" I wasn't looking for weekly lawn service I was searching for a one time landscape install.  Their website says they provide this type of service, and their office says they service parts of Owens Cross Roads, but don't cover where  I live in Meridianville.  A check of Google maps shows it's basically the same travel distance.  Must be nice to be doing so well that Legacy can afford to turn down a job, sight unseen.

resp.text: Thank you for your response.  You are correct in that we have a set distance of service from our location.  When our office is given an address of service, we then check to see if that address is within the distance we have set for our service area.  Each address is unique and may fit into our service area whether it be in Owens Cross Roads or Meridianville.  It is necessary to have perimeters in order to provide the most cost effective price for both our potential customers and our company.  Good Luck on your project.

name: Mike Gordon
text: Don't bother calling them if you are locating over the mountain in the Hampton Cove area. They even say they serve the "Huntsville" area, but I guess not. I'll take my business elsewhere.

resp.text: Mike, thank you for your feedback. You are correct in that we have a set distance of service from our location. When our office is given an address of service, we then check to see if that address is within the distance we have set for our service area. Each address is unique and may fit into our service area whether it be in Huntsville or Hampton Cove. It is necessary to have perimeters in order to provide the most cost effective price for both our potential customers and our company. Good Luck on your project.

name: Grant Patten
text: Amazing work! Went above and beyond, we were very satisfied. We had them come out for lawn service / hedge trimming / tree trimming / bush removal as well as lawn mowing, and we would definitely use Legacy Outdoor Services again in the future.

resp.text: Thank you so much for allowing us to help you with your project!

name: Mark Bailey
text: I had Legacy install a partial fence for our backyard.  The work was performed quickly and well done.  Very satisfied.

resp.text: Mark,  Thank you ever so much for allowing us to help you with your fence project.  We know you will enjoy the privacy for many years to come!

name: Wes G Smith
text: I would not use this contractor again, nor would I recommend them to anyone else.  They did a drainage project for me where I explicitly described the design I wanted and it incorporated solid PVC pipe.  On the day of the job, the workers showed up with corrugated pipe.  When I called the owner, he stated that PVC would be $800 more, so feeling like I didn't want to start over with another contractor, I told him to go ahead.  Then I found out that a portion of the water to be drained to the street running from the downspout  was going through perforated corrugated pipe (pipe with holes).  They assured me that the water would be moving and would not leak out into already saturated ground (yeah, right).  Then I came home to find that the grate to catch water coming off the sidewalk was about 1 and a half to 2 inches away from the sidewalk, requiring the water to run over dirt before entering the grate.  The owner tried to tell me that it would be no problem and the bare dirt would not erode despite water constantly running over it.  I insisted that concrete be put between the sidewalk and grate to keep the water from washing out the dirt.  When I came home, I found they had used a type of caulk between the grate and the sidewalk, and had done a messy job of it, I don't know if that much caulk will ever cure.  After two days it is still soft.  Additionally, where they cut through the curb, the re-concreting was extremely poorly done.  It looked like they didn't even use a trowel, much less a curbing tool.  It looked like they basically packed the concrete on with their fingers and left it.  Part of the contract called for doing a brick border along the sidewalk.  After I paid them for the portion of the contract for the drainage, they informed me that they were waking away from the contract and that I needed to find someone else to do the edging.  The pity is, the subcontractor they had lined up to do the masonry work actually sounded very competent.  Bottom line, this is a company that, in my opinion, cut corners at every opportunity, poorly designed the project, provided shoddy workmanship, and then walked away with nearly half of the contracted work unperformed.

name: Matthew Buxton
text: My experience with Legacy Outdoor Services was great from start to finish. Austin and his crew did a great job, furthermore everything was cleaned up before they left.

resp.text: Matthew,  It was such a pleasure working with you on your project!  Austin and the crew were so very thankful for your help during the process and we are so happy we were able to help you with your drainage issues!

name: Carey Rosenblum
text: Legacy outdoor has serviced my home grounds for several years. They installed a designed row of arborvite trees along my rear property line that are very healthy and provide a natural green screen of privacy. Otherwise they have come out annually to do some re-mulching in my flowerbeds and have given them thst extra spark in appearance. If you have some landscaping issues or need suggestions I would recommend them. They are honest and do good work.

name: Jennifer Benavides
text: Dependable, honest and hardworking! Thank you Legacy for a great job once again.

resp.text: Jennifer, thank you so much for allowing us to help you with your project.  Can't wait to see what your next project will bring!

name: matt demuro
text:
This company gave me probably the worst experience that I have had with a company that has done work for me. I contracted with them to do drainage work, a sprinkler system and landscape lighting.

I was told this would take 3 weeks to complete, with each phase occurring on consecutive weeks. The project as a whole took almost 12 weeks to complete, and this was only because I hounded them with calls multiple times per week.

The drainage work was the first part, it seemed to be fine, though the French drain was not placed the complete length that was discussed originally. Also the fingers of river rich were put in to stop erosion, but almost no grass seed was put in afterwards, so nothing but weeds grew in between the river rock.

The second piece was the sprinkler system. This was put in during a day, but the ground was not backfilled properly and they needed to come back out to fix it. We were told that they would put down grass seed after the lighting job was completed. The lighting work was not completed for another 8 weeks, and there wasn’t any seed put down afterwards. They were also supposed to aerate and oversees the lawn, but since they could not get their mower into our backyard, they told us they would come back with a smaller mower to pull the aerator later. This never happened.

I had to call them 2-3 times a week for 8 weeks to get them to complete the lighting. Part of it was landscape lighting, the other portion was putting in a fan and spotlight in/on our screened patio. The wiring was placed so shallow, that it came out of the ground within a week and they had to come back to fix. The light and fan was supposed to be put in by an electrician, but was just put in by the owner and his friend. They put a cheap conduit over the electrical wire that didn’t even cover the wire.  They sent an electrician out to fix the wiring, but he just rigged another kind of conduit on the bare wire to cover it up.  The uplighting for the trees was sold to us at $65 a light. I just found the lights online for $45 for a 4-pack of lights.

We just gave up with this company and figured we would just be stuck with this work. Over the last year, I kept burying and covering up the wire as it came out of the ground and have been trying to repair the grass in the area where they did sprinkler and drainage work. We are still fighting massive weeds from the lack of follow through on planting grass after their work was completed.

I am writing this review today after I just finished replacing 3 lights that stopped working and half of the wiring that was put in for the landscape lights. Turns out they believe that wire nuts are not necessary and you only need to tape wires together with electrical tape before putting it in the ground.

If you are looking for a company to do landscaping work for you, stay very far away from this company. You will only be sorry if you choose them.

resp.text: Thank you for bringing all of this to our attention.  Unfortunately scheduling can be a challenge when dealing with different elements and sometimes issues arise.  For example the drainage was delayed due to an unmarked water pipe, flooding the drainage trenches.   The ceiling fan was installed by a certified electrician, as was the wiring for the fan, flood lights and outdoor switch.  We would be more than happy to provide the name of the electricians that provided these services.   The contract states that there is a year warranty covering defects in workmanship and materials.   Is regrettable that we did not have the opportunity to fix the issues that you were having with your lights, thus alleviating some of your frustration.  If we had only known of the issues we would have been more than happy to fulfill the contact’s one year warranty.  Again thank you for your comments and we will take them all into consideration to better our services.

name: Stephen Rice
text: I highly recommend Legacy Outdoor Services. Our neighbors compliment our yard all the time and these guys have helped with minor and complex issues on our property. We trust them 100% and most of all, they are super professional for a service company.

resp.text:

name: Elle Johnson
text: Well look what popped up to be reviewed. I was going to roll with the punches since the company was a sub under Woodland Homes but since old Google wants to know...my opinion. Horrible company!!!! If I could give it a negative star I would. This company has no pride in their work. They laid our sod all kind of crazy in the dead of winter and didn't roll it properly. And, it's a non warranty service so there lies the problem. If most are doing a job they never have to return to then they are not going to put too much pride in doing the job. Every home in this subdivision has issues with the sprinkler systems Largen installed. Company and companies who use and treat people unfairly...well we all know what happens. name: Earkley Frazier
text: Excellent service, great job

name: Andrea Morriss
text:
From our first meeting until the end of our project, we are so pleased we chose Father Nature. The project managers, landscapers, stone masons, fence builders, and designers were all excellent. Everyone was easy to work with, anxious to please, showed up when they said, gave wonderful advise, and cleaned up at the end of the day. They went over and beyond our expectations.
They were also helpful in keeping us within our budget and working with us during these strange pandemic days. Being self isolated during our backyard project was challenging but everyone worked with us to keep us safe.
We would recommend Father Nature for any project...large or small.

resp.text: Andrea, Thank you so much for reaching out with positive feedback! I'll be sure to bump Hamilton's vacation time from 3 days to 4 (JK). He enjoyed getting to work with you and thank you for trusting us with your project! Sincerely, FN

name: Gloria Jackson
text:
I called the company Tuesday asked for an estimate to fix my backyard making it nice.
The lady wasn't sure if they service my area so she promised to call me back let me know. No phone calls or messages from them since. Reliable, I don't think so.

resp.text: Gloria, I'm embarrassed and apologetic for the game of phone tag you and my receptionist had. Our bookings have been unseasonably high due to Covid-19. Keeping up with the shrinking service areas and availability has been tricky to balance our long term clients and allowing new clients into our mix. Please accept my apology and reconsider your overall evaluation of my company. Having single stars by potential clients that simply call in and haven't worked with us is irreversible catastrophic to our image.

name: Laura Harris
text: Father Nature Landscapes did a wonderful job for my back yard project. I'm a bit Type A and an interior designer, so I have specific wants for my projects. Bryant communicated with me through the entire process - responded quickly and always modified our plans to meet my requests. Their pricing was reasonable, and the installers were skilled and professional. They finished in the time frame specified per our schedule, fixed my drainage problems, and it looks better than I had ever imagined. I highly recommend them for anyone who wants to love their yard. I'm now planning to have them work on the front yard too.

resp.text: Thank you! We really enjoyed working with you!

name: Jane Underwood
text: Father Nature is a top notch, full service landscaping firm.  When I think quality, I think Father Nature.  Most recently I worked with Andrew, Collin and Julio on several different jobs at the Birmingham Botanical Gardens. Each one kept me in the loop on what was being done, how it was going to be accomplished and when the job was completed.  If there was a way to give them 10 stars, that is what I would give this amazing team.

resp.text: Oh my gosh, Thank you Jane for your kind words! We love getting to work with you too!!!

name: Scott G
text: Father Nature has been a pleasure to work with.  They've done multiple projects for us all of which have turned out great!  I highly recommend them.

resp.text: Thanks Scott! Love getting to work with you!

name: margo Estella
text: They have the best employees and workers I have ever seen an wen they do a job its like magic they all deserve an award for good work

resp.text: OH MY GOSH! Thank you so much! Will tell the team in the morning. It only works because we get to work with cool people. People that love living outside.

name: Lauren Hinson
text: Great work on several projects. Happy to recommend them to friends.

resp.text: Thank you Lauren!

name: Harry Giles
text:
My wife and I have never dealt with such a creative and professional team in our lives. Father Nature has completely transformed our home.  They initially did a complete redo of our backyard.  The design and the attention to detail were far beyond what we have previously experienced.  They just finished with our front yard and we are just blown away.  If you are looking for someone to raise the bar on what you think your “outdoor” home could be then call them.

We are deeply indebted to Father Nature Landscapes for giving us a home that we could never have envisioned without them.

resp.text: I'm now realizing that I haven't thanked you for this Harry. This review has been extremely appreciated and we're thankful for our relationship with you two! It is easy to get a win when both client and contractor have the same end goals! So fun to get to do these projects with you!

name: Richard Ropog
text: Gave me a competitive price, but it was their professionalism that sold me.  Always on time and came in under budget.  Could not be happier with Father Nature.

resp.text:
Thank you Richard for the review! Too kind! We enjoy working with you and look forward to working with you again in the future!

Sincerely,

FNL.

resp.text: Thank you for your review! Also, would you ever consider bumping our rating up to 5 stars? We fight to be a 5 star team and would love to know if there is anything we could do to help your rating of us?

name: Danny Graves
text: Great experience using Alabama Tree Service! Steve came out to look at our trees and recommended actions. His team came and made quick work pruning our crape myrtle trees and magnifying their appearance and the curb appeal of our home. I highly recommend the team for your tree needs.

resp.text: Thank you so much sir for your kind words. It was a pleasure working with you on this project. Please let us know if you need anything.

name: Gabi Wenzelow
text:
Alabama Tree Service did a great job😀 cutting down a huge pine tree which was right against the house. They have all the equipment needed to undertake a huge job. They have enough staff and enough machinery get the job done.
They even cleaned everything up afterwards and sanded the yard where the bucket truck had to come through.
As they worked  The debris that was hauled to the curb woz periodically picked up and hauled off,so there was no overflow causing havoc in the neighbourhood.
There was no damage done during the cutting to my house or the neighbour's house. They were well organized, came on time And when they said they were going to come. They worked long and hard until the job was done.  I also had to stump ground. The price was what was agreed on at the time the estimate.
I would recommend Alabama tree service to my family and friends.

text: I can't wait for a return trip to Birmingham so that I can come to Charlie thigpen's Garden Gallery again! They have the most amazing varieties of plants that I have never heard of. text: I enjoyed looking at the products, but felt as if I was being treated differently because I had my toddler with me . It was obvious that I was monitoring what she was doing, but one of the employees decided to tell her (me, indirectly) that what she was touching was hand carved and very expensive after watching us like a hawk in the store. I found several things that I liked, but couldn’t bring myself to support this business because of the way we were treated.

name: Alexandra Murray
text: David S**** the owner inspected a drainage easement on our property and was able to advise us as homeowners the steps to correct drainage and erosion control issues. He provided several ideas and advised us to contact the county and builder to have these issued corrected. He has all the technology to take aerial footage and soil samples to obtain accurate information and is incredibly knowledgeable! He went above and beyond for us and I know he truly had our families best interest. I would recommend DSLD to anyone without a doubt.

name: Laura Witcher
text: I called several companies about an immediate project and possible other projects. When David Sharp showed up at our door we had a pleasant surprise. Not only is he a great person, but he was my husband’s youth director years ago and they got to have a little reunion. DSLD filled in and tiled a front porch that was formerly a long planter box. We had previously spoken to many others about the project and never was happy with the response, the quotes, or how the others listened to what we wanted. We are so pleased with DSLD’s work, how quickly they completed the project, how well they communicated with us, and the quoted amount for the work that they have us as customers from now on! Plus all the staff are very friendly and helpful!

resp.text: It was so good to meet you Laura and catch up with James!  Thank you for your kind words and we look forward to working with you in the future.

name: Chase Carter
text:
This review is kind of overdue,  but getting the pool ready for this season reminded me I’ve yet to write one.  DSLD installed a Desjoyaux pool at our house last spring.  From design work (Stephen) to the crew that installed our pool (PM Austin) we were very pleased and our backyard was completely transformed.  Their vision for our backyard and the product they delivered completely surpassed (in a good way) the one we thought possible.  Our project consisted of not just the pool install, but rerouting/hiding a drainage ditch that went through the middle of our yard, regrading the entire backyard, sprinkler install and pouring a parking pad.  DSLD was capable of handling the entire project without having to contract out things here or there so it was nice only having to deal with one company from start to finish.

And probably most importantly David and his team are good people.  5 stars and highly recommended.

name: Robert Anaforian
text:
DSLD has earned our highest recommendation. Throughout our project David and the entire team demonstrated integrity, creativity, top notch customer service, professionalism, and premier craftsmanship.
You will not be disappointed!

name: Rob Sharp
text:
DSLD traveled to mine and David’s mom’s house. The backyard was approx 110 ft and open to all, no privacy. I watched the crew scalp the old lawn and graded down to a more level surface. Then they planted about 20 trees which served as a privacy fence. Mixed in a variety of bushes and plants. I could only imagine how it would look when all planting matured. They laid new sod and it looked like a picture from Home and Garden magazine.

Through the years I have visited my brother and his family and he’d take me on job sites with him. I was amazed to see the complexity of installs he was undertaking. The attention to detail David gives to each install is second to none. I could write a few pages just on that subject. (But I won’t) His new store AquaScapes was an overnight success. I tribute this to David’s insight of products as well as knowledge of the industry. Offering fountains, fish ponds, fish of course and swimming pools from the store, has only broadened the DSLD complete landscape portfolio.

I have to tip my hat to my brother and his team of professionals. His sons Zachary, Miles and Cole play a major part in this well oiled machine as they each have a part in most every install. They are dependable, punctual and treat each job as if it were being installed on their property.

Rather you have DSLD perform their expertise on your yard or not, you have to admire how far they have come.

Wishing you all continued success!

name: Daisy Hawkins (Hope Series)
text: The most professional one stop shop for all that I needed.  This team landscaped the front and back, built a screened in patio.  Created and installed all new flagstone walkway and side patio and surrounding my new beautiful water fountain from their Aquascapes location at Hanna's Garden on 280.  Then painted my entire exterior on my house and addition.  Very professional, hard-working, and eager to accommodate any requests I had.  Highly recommend this group for your outdoor hardscape and landscape.  I loved not having to be the contractor on all these things.  They handled all for me.

name: Laerke Costov
text: Run as fast as you can in the opposite direction! Avoid at all costs!

name: R Daniel Chang
text: David came by for our consultation on time. He was very attentive to our questions and concerns. We're still in the process of making final decisions on contractors and builders but dsld is certainly at the top of the list.

name: Steve Skelton
text:
I could not be more pleased with this company! They are professionals in every sense of the word.
They have done multiple projects for myself and my wife. They are what I would call...outdoor wizards!
They have installed amazing landscape lighting for us, completely redesigned our shrub and flower beds, and installed the most awesome landscape masonry borders I’ve ever seen. I have a large fountain in one of the shrub beds in the front of my house. Mind you, this thing weighs like a bazillion lbs. I was recently trying to clean it out and get it ready for Spring and Summer. I accidentally let the bowl tip off the pedestal. Well, I tried to lift it up and get it back on the pedestal. I suppose I’m not as young as I used to be, because I couldn’t budge it. I really didn’t know what to do, so I called DSLD and asked if they could come by and get this monster back on the pedestal. It wasn’t more than a day later, when I got in from work when I noticed that my fountain was sitting upright, filled with water, just waiting to be plugged in. When I called Zach Sharp, ( a great young man by the way) to ask what I owed them, he absolutely refused to take a cent, saying it only took a few minutes and I could not get them to take anything for their time and trouble. In today’s world, qualities like that are rare. If you ever need any type of landscape architecture, a pool, anything “outdoorsy”,
These are the guys. They are 5 stars in every category and I could not give them a higher recommendation.
Don’t waste your money on shoddy work! Call DSLD . They are definitely the best!

Steve Skelton
Dunnavant Place at Highland Lakes

name: Jason Hall
text: DSLD does excellent work. It’s almost hard to believe it’s the same yard from before to after. The yards they have worked on and completed are the type of yards you would see on TV or magazines the quality is so good.

name: Heather Brown
text:
DSLD rescued our backyard garden! In March, we used another landscaping service to prepare landscaping beds and plant hydrangeas, roses, azaleas, camellias, gardenias, etc. The beds were not properly prepared, and the plants became diseased, stressed, and began to die very quickly. We also had a serious drainage problem.

DSLD determined why our new plants were failing, recommended solutions, and implemented their plan; amending the soil and replanting the plants we already had. They also solved our drainage problem. Now, we have a gorgeous backyard!!!

We highly recommend DSLD!

name: Lauren Clemons
text: Great communication and presentation of information on their entire pool building and landscape design process!  I appreciate the quick responsiveness and the professionalism so far.  Excited to get started on our back yard transformation project!!

resp.text: Thank you for your kind reply. Look forward to working with you on the design.

name: Lou Eppolito
text: Design work was functional and attractive. Implementation was first rate. DSLD stands behind its work. Overall, a great experience!

name: Ron Boisclair
text: Exceptional client service, workmanship and a great team. Working with DSLD owner David Sharp was a pleasure. He responded to my inquiry within a day and met with me within a week to discuss options for landscape and drainage work on my Highland Lakes home--the $100 up-front consult fee was a worthwhile investment, and was applied to to the cost of my project. Work included expanding, grading, and sodding (Zoiysa) the backyard, which included construction of a 70 foot concave curved/step-graduated wall, installing a new drainage system along and under the driveway, and adding an external sump pump well and pump to move water from a tied-in roof downspout and overhead deck drain. DSLD completed the project in approx. 2 weeks.  Good communications throughout, with detail breakdown of proposal costs.  Definately recommend.

name: Stan Ingram
text: Pleasure to work with.  They did everything they promised in good time.

name: R Heffner
text: Phillips

name: Shanna Jennings
text: I am very happy with the stock plan that we purchased and had amended. Initially it was going to be a few small changes, and it turned into a much larger project than anyone anticipated. Throughout all the changes, the team was responsive and quickly turned changes around for approval. They even worked with my builder to finalize a few details that he needed to show for permit purposes. I am hoping that we are building our forever home, but if not, I would not hesitate to use ERDD again. Money well spent.

name: Holland Dixon
text: They took our vision and produced a work of art allowing me to refine my future building project. Correcting things we didn't see or hadn't thought of and highlighted useful addition needed to be functional. Very professional, always responsive and overall a GREAT company to work with!

name: Renée Dates
text: Multiple phone calls and messages left for a job. All calls are screened and no one will follow-up with repeated requests for assistance. The poor reviews are absolutely correct - THEY DO NOT CALL OR FOLLOW-UP! BEWARE OF THIS COMPANY!

resp.text: You are a customer of our client Bama Sheds. We have been in contact with Bama Sheds.  If  they have not been in contact with you that is not something we can control.

name: Kristie Potts
text: Absolutely terrible. I paid a deposit for future home plans. I was very descriptive when speaking to Christy about my plans- One level barndo, specific interior layouts and sq ft. She explained to me that they certainly could design my plans. I paid a deposit, sent the EXACT exterior structure of what I wanted, along with additional interior layout and door. I heard nothing for several weeks, with many phone call attempt. I received a random email apologizing for the delay, that a family member had an illness. Weeks go by again with no returned calls. Finally, I requested they return my deposit and I would outsource a more reliable designer. I recently received another random email with some generic sketches that were nothing of mine. I responded and asked them if they were able to adequately provide services.- NO RESPONSE. I have since then called multiple times, left multiple messages in request to have my deposit refunded. As of today, I have reported them and contacted my bank. After reading reviews and doing further research( I should have prior to hiring them)I see the EXACT same scam happening over and over. What a waste of my time, money and energy!

resp.text: The project was delivered late but we did provide two options based on the client provided sketch and exterior she was looking for.

name: Brent Timmerman
text:
BEWARE! DO NOT DO BUSINESS WITH THESE PEOPLE!

I will spare the specifics of my experience, However I will warn any prospective person interested to please read the reviews. They ( The bad reviews)are highly accurate !
These people will take your money, and disappear from communication.  With the exception of lying to you through messenger app.. And then when you are able to contact them from a different phone number that they are not screening,  they will blame you for their VERY UNETHICAL business dealings . With that being said, I have nothing to gain from this review,  however I am out 400.00 for services that I never received,  And based on reviews that I have now read. name: Chris Gourley
text: We are happy with our plans from ERDD. They did their best to help us to design our forever home and we are happy with the end results. They were willing to make many changes to the original design which shows they are willing to go the extra mile to make their customers happy. They came to our home initially to see where the house would be built and we had our finished plans within 2 1/2 weeks. They could have finished much quicker but my wife and I made a lot of changes so we went thru about 11 drafts to get to the finished project. The fact that they were willing to work with us to this extent means we would use them again if we ever need an architect again.

name: Jackie Wirth
text: Not an actual client, but based off the repeated and disappointing testimonials of others... I would suggest avoiding this company.  The accusations, articles, and evidence provided are so concerning that these individuals should be investigated.

I received zero updates from ERD&D, we reached out dozen of times per email & phone only to be given the run around. --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Response from the owner 3 weeks ago
Mr. Vermeulen.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

text: Great work at a reasonable price.  Having some delays in the delivery of the plans is the only reason for not getting a 5.

name: Nona Muss
text:
So last year I found a business on a local small business group Facebook page - Elaine Roberts Drafters and Designers. I paid them a deposit of $250. As of today, the work has not been delivered. It was promised 10 days after payment. As of today, they are 100 days past due. I posted an honest review on their Facebook page, starting off by saying I hoped I could change it to a positive review in the near future. They changed their Facebook template to not allow reviews so mine could no longer be seen. They always say they are working on my plan and they will have something in a few days. Then I don't hear from them and nothing is ever delivered. Their Facebook page has photos they post- and therefore imply that the work depicted is their own. Through reverse photo look up I found photos they had "lifted" from other sites and I contacted the owners. Indeed they did not have permission to use the photos and it was not their work. When I tagged the owners in the misused photos they were promptly deleted from the Elaine Roberts drafters Facebook page. One of the owners of the business from which they had plagiarized the photos of others' work, did know Jimmy Parker - one of the owners of Elaine Roberts Drafters. He told me specifics of how the owner (Jimmy) of Elaine Roberts Drafters worked for him previously and had stolen from him, and described him as one of the biggest con-men he has encountered. Perhaps occasionally they deliver a product enough to keep up an image, I don't know, but after my own experience and what I heard from Jimmy Parker's previous employer, I sure wouldn't trust him with my money again!

Also look at their other reviews. Jimmy and Christy Parker are the husband/wife team that “own/operate’ this business they call Elaine Roberts Drafting and Design. (These are their respective middle names.)  Previously they operated under the name “Creekside Designs.” I guess they had to give up on that name after they accumulated so many bad reviews. You can google it. Anyway, three of the other reviews for this business are from the owners themselves (Christy Parker, Jimmy Parker, and their old business named Creekside Designs. A fourth is from a family member - Sheila Parker. So half of the reviews contributing to their “4.1” rating are ones THEY CREATED RATING THEMSELVES! They did the same thing on Yelp until I reported them and Yelp notified me they had removed those reviews because they violated their terms.

resp.text:
Mrs. Hall,
I am terribly sorry for the poor customer service that we provided.  We are not scammers, crooks, or anything of that nature.  We simply took on to much work at one time. It is not an excuse but we are still learning how to deal with our blessing of growing pains.  We are human and make mistakes.   I am terribly sorry that your project fell through the cracks.  In regards to your refund we asked for a mailing address to process you refund and I have not yet received it.

Again we are sincerely sorry for the poor customer service and wish you all the best in the future.
Respectfully,
Christy Parker
